question.text: The value of <math><mi>x</mi></math> for which <math><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mfenced close=")" open="(" separators="|"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">cot</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mrow></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">cos</mi></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">tan</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></math> is

solution.text:
Let, cot-1⁡x+1=θ and tan-1⁡x=ϕ

Now, given equation becomes sinθ=cosϕ

⇒11+x+12=11+x2

⇒x+12+1=x2+1⇒x=-12

question.text: The value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><msqrt><mn>63</mn></msqrt><mn>8</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> is

solution.text:
The given trigonometric ratio

=cos12cos-1coscos-118

=c cos12cos-118

=1+coscos-1182=34

Note: One may also proceed by writing the

ratio as cos12sin-1638.

question.text: The value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>17</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>10</mn></math> is equal to

solution.text:
sin-1⁡sin⁡17=sin-1⁡sin⁡17-5π+5π
=5π-17
cos-1⁡cos⁡10=cos-1⁡cos⁡10-3π+3π
=cos-1⁡cos⁡3π+10-3π
=cos-1⁡-cos⁡10-3π
=π-cos-1⁡cos⁡10-3π
=π-10-3π=4π-10
Hence, sin-1⁡sin⁡17+cos-1⁡cos⁡10=9π-27

question.text: The value of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mfenced close="}" open="{" separators="|"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> is equal to <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>

solution.text:
Let cot-11x=α⇒ tan⁡α= x
So, cos⁡α=11+x2
∴ sin⁡cot-1⁡cos⁡tan-1⁡x
= sincot-111+x2
Let cot-111+x2=β⇒ cot⁡β=11+x2
∴sin⁡β=(1+x2)(2+x2)
∴sin⁡β=sin⁡cot-1cos⁡cot-1⁡1x=1+x22+x2

question.text: If the value of the expression <math><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">tan</mi></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">cos</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mn>5</mn></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mrow></math> is in the form of <math> <mrow> <mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><msqrt> <mi>b</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> </math> where <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mi>b</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi>Z</mi><mo>,</mo></math> then the value of <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow> <mi>b</mi> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> is

solution.text:
We know that,

tan⁡x2=1-cos⁡xsin⁡x 

∴  tan⁡12cos-1⁡25 =1-cos⁡cos-1⁡25sin⁡cos-1⁡25

=1-2/5sin⁡sin-1⁡1/5

=1-2/51/5=5-2

Now,  a+ b =−2+ 5

⇒a=−2 and b=5

Hence,  a+b b = 3 5 =0.6

question.text: If <math><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>, then the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math> is

solution.text:
Given that, sin-1⁡13+sin-1⁡23=sin1⁡x

Taking sine on both sides

⇒⁡131-49+231-19=⁡x

⇒⁡13.53+23.83=⁡x

⇒ ⁡5+429=⁡x

∴    x=5+429

question.text: The complete solution set of the inequality <math><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">cos</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">cos</mi><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>></mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mi> </mi></math>is

solution.text:
As, cos-1⁡(cos⁡4)=cos-1⁡cos⁡2π-4=2π-4

⇒   2π-4>3x2-4x

⇒   3x2-4x-2π-4<0

⇒   2-6π-83<x<2+6π-83

question.text: If <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo></math> then

solution.text:
Let, x=sin⁡2θ (where tan⁡θ=3)
⇒x=2tan⁡θ1+tan2θ=61+9=35
If α=tan-143 

⇒y=sinα2=121-cosα
=121-35=15
∴y2=15⇒y2=2x-1

question.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>tan</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>sec</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><msqrt><mn>5</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></math> is equal to:

solution.text:
Given,

tan2tan-115+sec-152+2tan-118

=tan2tan-115+tan-118+tan-112

=tan2tan-115+181-140+tan-112

=tan2tan-113+tan-112

=tantan-12×131-132+tan-112

=tantan-134+tan-112

=tantan-134+121-38

=tantan-15458

=tantan-12

=2

question.text: The value of <math><mn>2</mn><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>65</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></math> is equal to

solution.text:
2sin-1⁡45+sin-1⁡513+sin-1⁡1665
=2sin-1⁡451-5132+5131-452+2sin-1⁡1665
=2sin-1⁡4865+1565+2sin-1⁡1665
=2sin-1⁡6365+sin-1⁡1665
=2cos-1⁡1665+sin-1⁡1665 ∵sin-1⁡x=cos-1⁡1-x2
=π

question.text: The number of solution of the equation <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>cot</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math> is

solution.text:
2tan-1x+cot-1x=7π6

⇒tan-1x+π2=7π6⇒tan-1x=2π3

⇒tan-1x∈-π2, π2x∈ϕ

question.text: The value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced open="[" close="]" separators="|"><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></msqrt><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></msqrt></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></msqrt><mo>-</mo><msqrt><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mfenced><mo> </mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mo>∀</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>∈</mo><mfenced open="[" close="]" separators="|"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> is equal to

solution.text:
tan-11-sin⁡x+1+sin⁡x1-sin⁡x-1+sin⁡x

=tan-11-sin⁡x+1+sin⁡x1-sin⁡x-1+sin⁡x1-sin⁡x+1+sin⁡x1-sin⁡x+1+sin⁡x

=tan-11-sin⁡x+1+sin⁡x+21-sin2x1-sin⁡x-1+sin⁡x=tan-121+cos⁡x-2sin⁡x

=tan-1-2cos2x22sinx2cosx2=tan-1-cotx2=tan-1cotπ-x2

=π2-cot-1cotπ-x2=π2-π-x2=x2-π2

question.text: If the equation <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>12</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>λ</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> has a real solution, then <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">λ</mi></math> is equal to

solution.text:
sin-11+2x-32+cos-1-1-2x-32+λx=0

x=32

⇒π2+π+3λ2=0⇒λ=-π.

question.text: If $\cos ^{-1} x+\cos ^{-1} y+\cos ^{-1} z=\pi$, then

solution.text:
Given that $\cos ^{-1} x+\cos ^{-1} y+\cos ^{-1} z=\pi$
$\begin{array}{l}
\Rightarrow \cos ^{-1}(x)+\cos ^{-1}(y)+\cos ^{-1}(z)=\cos ^{-1}(-1) \\
\Rightarrow \cos ^{-1}(x)+\cos ^{-1}(y)=\cos ^{-1}(-1)-\cos ^{-1}(z) \\
\Rightarrow \cos ^{-1}\left(x y-\sqrt{1-x^{2}} \sqrt{\left.1-y^{2}\right)}=\cos ^{-1}\{(-1)(z)\}\right. \\
\Rightarrow x y-\sqrt{\left(1-x^{2}\right)\left(1-y^{2}\right)}=-2 \\
\Rightarrow(x y+z)=\sqrt{\left(1-x^{2}\right)\left(1-y^{2}\right)}
\end{array}$
Squaring both sides we get $x^{2}+y^{2}+z^{2}+2 x y z=1$ Trick: Put $x=y=z=\frac{1}{2}$, so that
$\cos ^{-1} \frac{1}{2}+\cos ^{-1} \frac{1}{2}+\cos ^{-1} \frac{1}{2}=\pi$
Obviously (d) holds for these values of $x, y, z$.

question.text: If <math><msup><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">cot</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn><mi> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">cot</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>, then the range of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi></math> will be

solution.text:
cot-1⁡x-5cot-1⁡x-2>0

⇒cot-1⁡x∈-∞, 2∪5, ∞

⇒cot-1⁡x∈0, 2   (Taking intersection with range of cot −1 x )

⇒n∈(cot⁡2, ∞)

question.text: The value of<mrow> <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>a</mi></math> </mrow>for which <math><mi>a</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">cos</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></math> has a real solution, is

solution.text:
Here, x2-2x+2=x-12+1≥1

But, -1≤(x2-2x+2)≤1

Which is possible only when

x2-2x+2=1

⇒x=1

Then, a12+sin-1⁡1+cos-1⁡1=0

⇒a+π2+0=0

⇒a=-π2

question.text: Number of real roots of the equation <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo> </mo><mn>4</mn></math> in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>]</mo></math> is

solution.text:
cos-1cos4=2π-4>π2 and sin-1sinx≤π2

⇒sin-1sinx=cos-1cos4has no real root.

question.text: The greatest and the least value of $\left(\sin ^{-1} x\right)^{3}+\left(\cos ^{-1} x\right)^{3}$ are

solution.text:
We have $\left(\sin ^{-1} x\right)^{3}+\left(\cos ^{-1} x\right)^{3}$
$\begin{array}{l}
=\left(\sin ^{-1} x+\cos ^{-1} x\right)^{3}-3 \sin ^{-1} x \cos ^{-1} x\left(\sin ^{-1} x+\cos ^{-1} x\right) \\
=\frac{\pi^{3}}{8}-3\left(\sin ^{-1} x \cos ^{-1} x\right) \frac{\pi}{2} \\
=\frac{\pi^{3}}{8}-\frac{3 \pi}{2} \sin ^{-1} x\left(\frac{\pi}{2}-\sin ^{-1} x\right) \\
=\frac{\pi^{3}}{8}-\frac{3 \pi^{2}}{4} \sin ^{-1} x+\frac{3 \pi}{2}\left(\sin ^{-1} x\right)^{2} \\
=\frac{\pi^{3}}{8}+\frac{3 \pi}{2}\left[\left(\sin ^{-1} x\right)^{2}-\frac{\pi}{2} \sin ^{-1} x\right] \\
=\frac{\pi^{3}}{8}+\frac{3 \pi}{2}\left[\left(\sin ^{-1} x-\frac{\pi}{4}\right)^{2}\right]-\frac{3 \pi^{3}}{32} \\
=\frac{\pi^{3}}{32}+\frac{3 \pi}{2}\left(\sin ^{-1} x-\frac{\pi}{4}\right)^{2}
\end{array}$
$\therefore$ The least value is $\frac{\pi^{3}}{32}$
and since $\left(\sin ^{-1} x-\frac{\pi}{4}\right)^{2} \leq\left(\frac{3 \pi}{4}\right)^{2}$
$\therefore$ The greatest value is $\frac{\pi^{3}}{32}+\frac{9 \pi^{2}}{16} \times \frac{3 \pi}{2}=\frac{7 \pi^{3}}{8}$.

question.text: The real solutions of the equation <math> <mrow> <msup> <mtext>tan</mtext> <mn>-1 </mn> </msup> <msqrt> <mtext>x</mtext> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <mtext>x</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> </msqrt> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mtext>sin</mtext> <mn>-1 </mn> </msup> <msqrt> <msup> <mtext>x</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>x</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </msqrt> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow></mfrac></mrow></math> are

solution.text:
tan -1  x x + 1 + sin -1  x 2 + x + 1 = π 2

⇒           tan -1  x 2 + x + sin -1  x 2 + x + 1 = π 2

This equation holds true, if

             x 2 + x ≥ 0   and   0 ≤ x 2 + x + 1 ≤ 1

Now,     x 2 + x ≥ 0   and   0 ≤ x 2 + x + 1 ≤ 1

⇒         x 2 + x ≥ 0   and   x 2 + x + 1 ≤ 1      ∵   x 2 + x + 1 > 0  for all x

⇒         x 2 + x ≥ 0   and   x 2 + x ≤ 0

⇒         x 2 + x = 0     ⇒    x = 0 , - 1 .

Clearly, these two values satisfy the given equation. Hence, x=-1, 0 are the solutions of the given equation.

question.text: The number of integers for which the equation <math><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">cos</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">tan</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>n</mi></mrow></mrow></math> has real solution(s) is

solution.text:
Given equation is π2+tan-1⁡x=n, ∀x∈[-1,1]
Now LHS ∈π4,3π4
Integers in this interval are 1 & 2

Hence, there are 2 integers for which the equation has real solutions

question.text: Let <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo></math> <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></math> and if <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi><mo>∈</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo></math> then

solution.text:
It is given that a=sin-1xsin-1x,

b=sin-1xcos-1x,c=cos-1xsin-1x

d=cos-1xcos-1x

Also, here x∈0,1

⇒cos-1x<sin-1x

Also, cos-1x>1

and sin-1x<1

∴cos-1xcos-1x is greatest and sin-1xcos-1x is least.

⇒ sin-1xsin-1x<cos-1xsin-1x

⇒d>c>a>b

question.text: The value of tan-1919+tan-1949+tan-1997+tan-19163+ … ∞ equals

solution.text:
S=limm→∞∑n=1mtan-199n2+3n+7=limm→∞∑n=1mtan-111+n2+n3-29

=limm→∞∑n=1mtan-1n+23-n-131+n+23n-13=limm→∞∑n=1mtan-1n+23-tan-1n-13

question.text: If <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>+</mo></math> upto <math><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi></math> terms <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mo>∀</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, then <math><mi>y</mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"/>

solution.text:
y=tan-111+x+x2+tan-11x2+3x+3+...+2n terms
=tan-1x+1-x1+x1+x+tan-1x+2-x+11+x+1x+2+......2n terms
=tan-1x+1-tan-1x+tan-1x+2-tan-1x+1+...+tan-1x+2n-tan-1x+2n-1
=tan-1x+2n-tan-1x
y0=tan-12n

question.text: The value of the expression <math> <mrow> <msup> <mtext>cot</mtext> <mn>-1 </mn> </msup> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mtext>cot</mtext> <mn>-1 </mn> </msup> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>9</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mtext>cot</mtext> <mn>-1 </mn> </msup> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mtext>cot</mtext> <mn>-1 </mn> </msup> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mn>9</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>.......</mtext> </mrow> </math> upto <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></math> terms is

solution.text:
Given expression  = tan -1  2 + tan -1  2 9 + tan -1  2 2 5 + tan -1  2 4 9 + ........

General term=22n-12=24n2-4n+1=21+4nn-1=2n-2n-21+2n2n-2

Tn=tan-1⁡2n-tan-1⁡2n-2

∴    Sum of the series =tan-1⁡2-tan-1⁡0+tan-1⁡4-tan-1⁡2+tan-1⁡6-tan-1⁡4+…tan-1⁡2n-tan-1⁡2n-2

=tan-1⁡2n-tan-1⁡0=tan-1⁡2n

question.text: The value(s) of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi></math> satisfying the equation <math><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> is/are

solution.text:
We have,
sin-1⁡1-x-2sin-1⁡x=π2
⇒sin-1⁡1-x=π2+2sin-1⁡x
⇒1-x=sin⁡π2+2sin-1⁡x
⇒1-x=cos⁡2sin-1⁡x
⇒1-x=cos⁡cos-1⁡1-2x2∵2sin-1⁡x=cos-1⁡1-2x2
⇒1-x=1-2x2
⇒x=2x2⇒x2x-1=0⇒x=0,12
For, x=12, we have
LHS =sin-1⁡1-x-2sin-1⁡x
=sin-1⁡12-2sin-1⁡12=-sin-1⁡12=-π6≠R.H.S.
So, x=12 is not a root of the given equation.
Clearly, x=0 satisfies the equation
Here, x=0 is the root of the given equation.

question.text: Solution set of <math><mo>[</mo><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>]</mo><mo>></mo><mo>[</mo><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">cos</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>]</mo><mo>,</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></math> where [.] denotes the greatest integer function, is

solution.text:
∵[ sin −1 x ]>[ cos −1 x ]

⇒   x>0

Here, cos-1 x=0,x∈(cos 1, 1]1,x∈(0, cos 1]

and  sin-1 x=0, x∈(0, sin 1 )1,x∈[sin 1, 1]

∴   x∈[sin 1, 1]

concepts: finding sum of series convertible to tan series

question.text: If <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>cot</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>α</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>cot</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>cot</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mn>8</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>cot</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mn>18</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>cot</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mn>32</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>…</mo><mo>.</mo></math> upto <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>100</mn></math> terms, then <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>α</mi></math> is:

solution.text:
Given cot-1(α)=cot-1(2)+cot-1(8)+cot-1(18)+….

=∑n=1100tan-124n2

=∑n=1100tan-1(2n+1)-(2n-1)1+(2n+1)(2n-1)

=∑n=1100tan-12n+1-tan-12n-1

=tan-1201-tan-11

=tan-1200202

∴cot-1(α)=cot-1202200

α=1.01

topics: Converting one Inverse T function to other Inverse T
concepts: questions on conversion of trig ratios

question.text: For <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>k</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">ℝ</mi></math>, let the solutions of the equation <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>cot</mi><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mfenced close="|" open="|"><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo><</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mfrac></math> be <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>α</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>β</mi></math>, where the inverse trigonometric functions take only principal values. If the solutions of the equation <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> are <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msup><mi>α</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msup><mi>β</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><mi>α</mi><mi>β</mi></mfrac></math>, then <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math> is equal to ______.

solution.text:
Given,

cossin-1xcottan-1cossin-1x=k

Now simplifying cossin-1x=coscos-11-x2=1-x2

So, cossin-1xcottan-1cossin-1x=k

becomes cossin-1xcottan-11-x2=k

And now solving  cottan-11-x2=cotcot-111-x2=11-x2

So, cossin-1xcottan-11-x2=k becomes 

cossin-1x1-x2=k

Now solving cossin-1x1-x2=1-2x21-x2

So, 1-2x21-x2=k

⇒1-2x2=k21-x2

⇒k2-2x2=k2-1

⇒x2=k2-1k2-2

So, roots are α=k2-1k2-2⇒α2=k2-1k2-2

And β=k2-1k2-2⇒β2=k2-1k2-2

Now finding 1α2+1β2=2k2-2k2-1 and αβ=-1

So, sum of roots of x2-bx-5=0 will be =1α2+1β2+αβ=b

⇒2k2-2k2-1-1=b      ⋯1

Product of roots of x2-bx-5=0 will be =1α2+1β2αβ=-5

⇒2k2-2k2-1-1=-5

⇒2k2-4=5k2-5

⇒3k2=1⇒k2=13   ⋯Put in 1

⇒b=2k2-2k2-1-1=5-1=4

bk2=413=12

question.text: The number of solutions of the equation <math><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> is/are

solution.text:
∵sin⁡x-1=1sin⁡x=cosec⁡x
Now, from graphs of sin-1⁡x,cosec⁡x

Clearly, both graph intersects at two points
∴ two solutions

question.text: The number of real solutions <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> where <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced open="|" close="|"><mi>y</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math>, is

solution.text:
In 0,π, y=sinx, y=cos-1cosx=x

In π,2π, y=sinx, y=cos-1cos2π-x=2π-x 

In -π,0, y=sinx, y=cos-1cos-x=-x

In -2π,-π, y=sinx, y=cos-1cos2π+x=2π+x 

Plotting the graphs, we have

There are 2 solutions, i.e., 0,0 and -2π,0.
